author: Al Jazeera
title: End â€˜unlawful killingsâ€™ in occupied West Bank, UN tells Israel - Al Jazeera English
text: End â€˜unlawful killingsâ€™ in occupied West Bank, UN tells Israel Latest UN report warns the situation in the territory is rapidly deteriorating and calls for accountability. The United Nations has called on Israel to end â€œunlawful killingsâ€ and settler violence in the occupied West Bank, warning of a rapidly deteriorating human rights situation during intensified Israeli raids. In a report published on Thursday, the UN Human Rights Office detailed a â€œsharp increaseâ€ in air strikes and military incursions into densely populated refugee camps, resulting in deaths, injuries and widespread damage to civilian infrastructure in the occupied territory. Keep readinglist of 4 items [Six killed in Israeli strike on refugee camp in occupied West Bank](/news/2023/12/27/six-killed-in-israeli-strike-on-refugee-camp-in-occupied-west-bank?traffic_source=KeepReading) [â€˜Unparalleledâ€™: Israeli army raids Ramallah, more occupied West Bank cities](/news/2023/12/28/unparalleled-israeli-army-raids-ramallah-more-occupied-west-bank-cities?traffic_source=KeepReading) [Israeli forces confiscate cash during raids in occupied West Bank](/program/newsfeed/2023/12/28/israeli-forces-confiscate-cash-during-raids-in-occupied-west-bank?traffic_source=KeepReading) â€œThe use of military tactics means and weapons in law enforcement contexts, the use of [unnecessary or disproportionate force](/news/2023/12/25/israel-intensifies-occupied-west-bank-raids-on-christmas-day), and the enforcement of broad, arbitrary and discriminatory movement restrictions that affect Palestinians are extremely troubling,â€ UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Turk said in a statement. Violence across the West Bank and occupied East Jerusalem [ has flared](/features/2023/12/20/no-safe-place-jenins-freedom-theatre-raided-daubed-with-star-of-david) since Israelâ€™s war on the Gaza Strip began on October 7. More than 21,000 Palestinians in Gaza have been killed, most of them civilians, after about 1,200 people were killed in Hamas attacks in southern Israel. Since then, the UN has verified the deaths of at least 300 Palestinians in the West Bank, including 79 children, the report said. Of these, 291 were killed by Israeli forces, eight by settlers and one was killed by either soldiers or settlers. Nearly 4,800 Palestinians have been arrested since the war on Gaza began. Since October 7, the UN has documented a â€œsharp rise in settler attacksâ€, including â€œshootings, burning of homes and vehicles, and uprooting of treesâ€. â€œI call on Israel to take immediate, clear and effective steps to put an end to settler violence against the Palestinian population, to investigate all incidents of violence by settlers and Israeli Security Forces, to ensure effective protection of Palestinian communities against any form of forcible transfer,â€ Turk said. â€œThe dehumanisation of Palestinians that characterises many of the settlersâ€™ actions is very disturbing and must cease immediately,â€ his statement added. Ajith Sunghay, the head of the UN Human Rights Office in the occupied Palestinian territories, told Al Jazeera that a lack of accountability â€“ and in some cases incitement from Israeli officials â€“ has led to a spike in both settler violence and violence committed by Israeli forces in the West Bank. â€œI think thatâ€™s extremely important to underscore â€“ where there is impunity violations will continue to happen,â€ Sunghay said. â€œThese statements [from Israeli officials] embolden settlers, give them a sense of security. It gives them a certain kind of permission to do what they want to do,â€ he added. [#UN]report: TÃ¼rk warns of rapidly deteriorating human rights situation in the West Bank, calls for end to violence. Read the report here ðŸ‘‰ [https://t.co/BGZChZobZg] [#OPT] [#WestBank] [#Jerusalem] [#ENDViolence] [https://t.co/Zk5NQ5zdEO] â€” UN Human Rights OPT (@OHCHR_Palestine) [December 28, 2023] Unparalleled incursions The report was released as Israeli forces began [one of the largest incursions](/news/2023/12/28/unparalleled-israeli-army-raids-ramallah-more-occupied-west-bank-cities) in the West Bank since the war started, launching a coordinated overnight assault on 10 cities, including Ramallah, the administrative headquarters of the Palestinian Authority. The raids, which continued until early on Thursday, targeted Palestinian money exchange outlets. A Palestinian man was also killed by Israeli forces on Thursday near a checkpoint west of the city of Bethlehem. Mustafa Barghouti, the general secretary of the Palestinian National Initiative party, believes the growing raids in the West Bank are an attempt by Israel to reoccupy the territory â€œcompletelyâ€. â€œThey are marginalising the Palestinian Authority, depriving it of all its authorities,â€ Barghouti told Al Jazeera. â€œThere is no security control by the Palestinian Authority because the Israeli army invades all cities, all [of] Area A that was supposed to be under the Palestinian Authority,â€ he said. â€œThis is a clear message from [Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin] Netanyahu. Heâ€™s saying thereâ€™s no place any more for any independent Palestinian authority here. Heâ€™s reoccupying the West Bank as he is trying to reoccupy Gaza.â€ Barghouti added that despite the Israeli claims that its raids are to fight against â€œterrorismâ€, the real goal is to â€œprovoke an intifada [uprising]â€. â€œNetanyahu knows very well if he leaves his position as prime minister, he will go to jail,â€ he said, referring to the corruption charges the Israeli leader is now on trial for. â€œThis man wants to extend the war in Gaza, to expand it, to continue it as long as possible.â€ Deadliest year for children Also on Thursday, UNICEF said 2023 has been the deadliest year for children in the occupied West Bank and East Jerusalem with 124 Palestinian and six Israeli children killed there since the start of the year. â€œAt least 83 children have been killed in the past 12 weeks â€“ more than double the number of children killed in all of 2022, amid increased military and law enforcement operations,â€ Adele Khodr, UNICEFâ€™s regional director for the Middle East and North Africa said in a statement. â€œMore than 576 have been injured, and others have reportedly been detained.â€

author: AI Writer
title: Lee Soon-sil's Heartfelt Journey on KBS 2TV's 'Let's Live Together'
text:
On January 23, viewers tuned into KBS 2TVâ€™s â€˜Letâ€™s Live Togetherâ€™ to witness an emotional segment featuring Lee Soon-sil. During the show, she prepared a North Korean-style bean stew. This dish reminded her of her childhood and her late parents. Lee Soon-sil shared her heart-wrenching story of losing both parents in a tragic accident. Her father died in a tunnel construction blast, while her mother, a cook, was killed by falling debris.
This devastating incident left a lasting impact on Lee Soon-sil. As she reminisced about her mother, her emotions resonated with fellow participants like Park Won-sook and Hye Eun-yi. Another guest, Shin Gye-sook, highlighted how childhood memories often connect with food. She emphasized the emotional bonds we form with our loved ones through shared meals.
Lee Soon-silâ€™s heartfelt reflections brought tears not only to her eyes but also to viewers at home. She painted a vivid picture of a life filled with love and loss. Lee shared memories of her mother as her confidante. The cooking segment became more than just a culinary demonstration; it served as a poignant reminder of how food evokes memories and connects us to those we have lost.
In todayâ€™s reality shows, which often emphasize superficial entertainment, Lee Soon-silâ€™s story stands out. It is a powerful testament to the resilience of the human spirit and the enduring ties of family. Viewers were left with a sense of empathy and understanding, showcasing the profound impact personal stories can have in a public forum.
Key Takeaways:
- Lee Soon-silâ€™s journey highlights the emotional connections we have with food.
- Sharing personal stories can foster empathy and understanding.
- The impact of family tragedy resonates deeply with many viewers.
By exploring Lee Soon-silâ€™s story, we see the broader implications of sharing personal narratives. It reminds us of the power of emotional storytelling and how culinary memories can heal. Food is not just nourishment; it is a bridge to our past and a way to honor those we love. This episode of â€˜Letâ€™s Live Togetherâ€™ beautifully illustrates how food can evoke cherished memories and foster connections among us.

author: Europa Press
title: El temporal de viento obliga a cancelar el Primavera Trompetera Festival que empezaba este viernes en Jerez (CÃ¡diz)
text:
JEREZ DE LA FRONTERA (CÃDIZ), 22 Mar. (EUROPA PRESS) -
La organizaciÃ³n del Primavera Trompetera Festival ha anunciado en un comunicado la cancelaciÃ³n de su octava ediciÃ³n, que comenzaba en la tarde de este viernes debido al fuerte viento que estÃ¡ soplando en la zona de celebraciÃ³n, en la explanada de aparcamientos del circuito de Jerez de la Frontera (CÃ¡diz).
Debido "a causas de fuerza mayor y a las previsiones climatolÃ³gicas adversas" que se han ratificado en el informe de Agencia Estatal de MeterologÃ­a, que sitÃºan a la zona en alerta amarilla por fuertes vientos, se ha decidido cancelar este festival para evitar poner en riesgo la seguridad del pÃºblico asistente.
"Hemos puesto todos los medios para que esta nueva ediciÃ³n de Primavera Trompetera Festival se desarrolle una vez mÃ¡s, empujados de nuevo por la confianza de nuestro pÃºblico y con la esperanza de mejora del tiempo y habiendo tomado medidas extraordinarias para acondicionar las instalaciones ante las inclemencias meteorolÃ³gicas, pero finalmente y tras valorar los informes tÃ©cnicos y de los cuerpos de seguridad, nos vemos obligados a tomar esta dolorosa decisiÃ³n", han seÃ±alado en su comunicado.
En concreto, los Ãºltimos informes desfavorables recibidos por el servicio de ProtecciÃ³n Civil en Jerez hacen que la celebraciÃ³n de este festival sea "inviable", ya que los vientos podrÃ¡n alcanzar velocidades superiores a los 80 km/h durante el fin de semana, un fenÃ³meno atmosfÃ©rico adverso que "puede provocar situaciones de riesgo y que nos obliga a tomar dolorosamente, pero de manera responsable, esta decisiÃ³n".
La organizaciÃ³n ha lamentado "los inconvenientes" que esta cancelaciÃ³n pueda ocasionar en el pÃºblico asistente y han anunciado que "en los prÃ³ximos dÃ­as" se podrÃ¡n en contacto con quienes tenÃ­an adquiridas entradas para ofrecer "las soluciones pertinentes" en cuanto a la devoluciÃ³n del importe de las entradas y anunciar las fechas de la prÃ³xima ediciÃ³n en 2025. AdemÃ¡s, han seÃ±alado que quienes decidan mantener sus entradas para la siguiente ediciÃ³n, lo harÃ¡n en las mismas condiciones en que fueron adquiridas para este 2024.
En el Primavera Trompetera Festival de 2024 estaban previstas las actuaciones de algunos nombres destacados del panorama actual como RVFV, Omar Montes, la Mala RodrÃ­guez, el Canijo de Jerez o Tote king, entre otros.
Leer mÃ¡s acerca de: Jerez de la Frontera

author: Via Bethune-Cookman University Athletics
title: El-Zein Tabbed SWAC Newcomer of the Week
text:
El-Zein Tabbed SWAC Newcomer of the Week
BIRMINGHAM, Ala. â€“ Bethune-Cookman Women's Tennis freshman Zahara El-Zein has been selected as the Southwestern Athletic Conference (SWAC) Newcomer of the Week for the period of March 19-25, announced Wednesday afternoon by the league office from its headquarters in Birmingham, Alabama. For Zahara El-Zein , this is the Harare, Zimbabwe native's first ever SWAC weekly award. Last week for the Wildcats, she was responsible for Women's Tennis collecting a point midweek in a home nonconference match to Northern Kentucky, with the Maroon and Gold falling on the day, 6-1. For El-Zein, she defeated NKU's Ana Isabela Serrano at No. 2...
Read more at Bethune-Cookman University Athletics
